{TUXFORD AND THE RAILWAY
For many years visitors came to Tuxford by horse drawn coaches. The village became famous as a resting place for weary travellers on their way from London to Edinburgh. But, on l5th July, l852 a new and faster visitor arrived, the steam locomotive. The railway brought many important people to Tuxford. In l886, the Prince of Wales, (later King Edward VII) got off his Royal Train and passed through Tuxford on his way to Rufford. All the boys from the Grammar School, and almost every villager stood and waved to the prince.
